answers.answer: What was the reason your treatment was stopped?  Were you not responding to the treatment?How long were you on treatment?  The reason I ask is that treatment gives the liver a rest, and has been shown to improve the condition of the liver, at least temporarily.Untreated, cirrhosis will eventually lead to liver failure, and the only treatment for that is a transplant.  I believe that it's possible to take a portion of someone else's liver, and perhaps someone in your family would be a match.There are others on this site who have experience with liver transplantation, so hopefully one of them will answer your post.Best of luck to you, I hope you find the answer you need.Lapis

From developing cirrhosis to needing a new liver is usually a journey of many years.I see you have diabetes which would make it even more difficult for the anti-viral treatment to work.The need for a new liver is measured by the MELD score-look it up on Google.Also look up 'living donor liver transplant Saudi Arabia'.That will tell which hospital and how much cost.A child or grandchild can often donate,but you are probably a long way from needing this procedure.You really need to know your MELD score first.To find out a
